metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15682 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
When a link to an external protocol was clicked, a prompt was presentedthat allowed the user to choose what application to open it in. An attackercould induce that prompt to be associated with an origin they didn'tcontrol, resulting in a spoofing attack. This was fixed by changingexternal protocol prompts to be tab-modal while also ensuring they couldnot be incorrectly associated with a different origin. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 82.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
